comments:
When attempting to try out the new framework hook support in Eclipse 3.2 I added the following 2 system properties to my PDE launcher:

osgi.hook.configurators.exclude=org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseLogHook
osgi.framework.extensions=org.eclipse.osgi.logexample

I had the org.eclipse.osgi.logexample project in my workspace and it was checked to be included during the launch, but it was unable to be located during the launch and caused the following error messages:

I now understand that the fragment must be in the same location as the host org.eclipse.osgi plugin in order for it to be located, but it seems that in cases where it cannot be located the entire framework shouldn't crash.

The cause of the error is because you disabled the org.eclipse.core.runtime.internal.adaptor.EclipseLogHook.  This hook will register the FrameworkLog implementation as an OSGi service.  Since your replacement hook is not being found you are not registering the FrameworkLog service.  The equinox.common is getting an NPE because of the missing service.  The equinox.common bundle could be improved to handle when the framework log service is not present.

I do not recommend addresing this for 3.2.

slipping to 3.3.  Moving to bundles where equinox.common lives, although it may not be possible to completely handle when the FrameworkLog is not present since the rest of Eclipse likely expects the service to be there.

Created an attachment (id=45495)
Patch

The patch fixes NPE exceptions in runtime if log service is not registered.

Released patch into CVS Head. 

This bug highlights a need for a "default" log service that platform could fall back on. I'll add a note to the bug 147824 on this.
